TITLE: Registering CalendarStore with Dependency Injection in .NET MAUI
DESCRIPTION: C# code to register the CalendarStore service with the MAUI dependency injection container for use throughout the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jfversluis/plugin.maui.calendarstore/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
builder.Services.AddSingleton(CalendarStore.Default);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using CalendarStore with Dependency Injection in a ViewModel
DESCRIPTION: C# example of a ViewModel class that uses dependency injection to access the CalendarStore service for reading calendar information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jfversluis/plugin.maui.calendarstore/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public class CalendarsViewModel
{
    readonly ICalendarStore calendarStore;

    public CalendarsViewModel(ICalendarStore calendarStore)
    {
        this.calendarStore = calendarStore;
    }

    public async Task ReadCalendars()
    {
        var calendars = await calendarStore.GetCalendars();

        foreach (var c in calendars)
        {
            Console.WriteLine(c.Name);
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Using CalendarStore Directly without Dependency Injection
DESCRIPTION: C# example of directly accessing the CalendarStore service through the Default static property without using dependency injection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jfversluis/plugin.maui.calendarstore/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public class CalendarsViewModel
{
    public async Task ReadCalendars()
    {
        var calendars = await CalendarStore.Default.GetCalendars();

        foreach (var c in calendars)
        {
            Console.WriteLine(c.Name);
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Adding Calendar Permissions to Android Manifest
DESCRIPTION: XML configuration for Android to request calendar read and write permissions in the AndroidManifest.xml file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jfversluis/plugin.maui.calendarstore/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_CALENDAR" />
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WRITE_CALENDAR" />
```

TITLE: Adding Calendar Permissions to iOS/macOS Info.plist for iOS 17+
DESCRIPTION: XML configuration for iOS 17+ to request calendar access permissions. Includes keys for write-only access and full access to calendar data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jfversluis/plugin.maui.calendarstore/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<key>NSCalendarsWriteOnlyAccessUsageDescription</key>
<string>This app needs your permission to write events to your calendars. This includes creating events, but not reading, modifying or deleting events.</string>

<key>NSCalendarsFullAccessUsageDescription</key>
<string>This app needs your permission to fully manage events on your calendars. This includes reading, writing, modifying and deleting events.</string>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Calendar Permissions to iOS/macOS Info.plist for iOS < 17
DESCRIPTION: XML configuration for iOS and macOS prior to iOS 17 to request calendar access permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jfversluis/plugin.maui.calendarstore/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<key>NSCalendarsUsageDescription</key>
<string>This app wants to access your calendars</string>
```

TITLE: Adding Calendar Permissions to Windows Package Manifest
DESCRIPTION: XML configuration for Windows to request appointments capability in the Package.appxmanifest file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jfversluis/plugin.maui.calendarstore/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```

```

TITLE: Configuring macOS Entitlements for Calendar Access
DESCRIPTION: XML configuration for the Entitlements.plist file required for sandboxed macOS applications to access calendar information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jfversluis/plugin.maui.calendarstore/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
<dict>
    <key>com.apple.security.app-sandbox</key>
    <true/>
    <key>com.apple.security.personal-information.calendars</key>
    <true/>
</dict>
</plist>
```

TITLE: Including Raw Assets in MAUI Project
DESCRIPTION: This XML snippet shows how to include raw assets in a MAUI project's .csproj file. It uses the MauiAsset Build Action to automatically handle the deployment of assets to the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jfversluis/plugin.maui.calendarstore/blob/main/samples/Plugin.Maui.CalendarStore.Sample/Resources/Raw/AboutAssets.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<MauiAsset Include="Resources\Raw\**" LogicalName="%(RecursiveDir)%(Filename)%(Extension)" />
```

TITLE: Loading MAUI Assets Using FileSystem
DESCRIPTION: This C# code demonstrates how to load a MAUI asset file asynchronously using the FileSystem class from .NET MAUI Essentials. It opens a file named 'AboutAssets.txt' from the app package and reads its contents.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jfversluis/plugin.maui.calendarstore/blob/main/samples/Plugin.Maui.CalendarStore.Sample/Resources/Raw/AboutAssets.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
async Task LoadMauiAsset()
{
    using var stream = await FileSystem.OpenAppPackageFileAsync("AboutAssets.txt");
    using var reader = new StreamReader(stream);

    var contents = reader.ReadToEnd();
}
```
